feature.evaluation

Class DiscreteAttributeEvaluator

  • java.lang.Object
    • feature.evaluation.DiscreteAttributeEvaluator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Info

    public abstract class DiscreteAttributeEvaluator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the basic functionality for discrete attribute evaluation and is extended by concrete approach implementations.

      • evaluate

        public abstract float evaluate(int attType,
             int attIndex)
        Evaluate the specified feature.
        Parameters:
        attType - Integer that is the feature type, as in DataMineConstants.
        attIndex - Index of the feature in its feature group.
        Returns:
        Float value that is the evaluation.

      • evaluateOnSubset

        public abstract float evaluateOnSubset(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> subset,
                     int attType,
                     int attIndex)
        Evaluate the specified feature.
        Parameters:
        subset - Indexes of the instance subset to evaluate the feature on.
        attType - Integer that is the feature type, as in DataMineConstants.
        attIndex - Index of the feature in its feature group.
        Returns:
        Float value that is the evaluation.

      • getTypeAndIndexOfLowestEvaluatedFeature

        public int[] getTypeAndIndexOfLowestEvaluatedFeature()
        Get the type and index of the feature with the lowest evaluation.
        Returns:
        Integer array of two elements, the first one being the type and the second one the index of the feature in its feature group.

      • getTypeAndIndexOfLowestEvaluatedFeatureOnSubset

        public int[] getTypeAndIndexOfLowestEvaluatedFeatureOnSubset(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> subset)
        Get the type and index of the feature with the lowest evaluation. This can yield best or worst features, depending on the type of estimator score.
        Parameters:
        subset - ArrayList of integer indexes defining the subset to analyze.
        Returns:
        Integer array of two elements, the first one being the type and the second one the index of the feature in its feature group.

      • getTypeAndIndexOfLowestEvaluatedFeatureOnSubset

        public int[] getTypeAndIndexOfLowestEvaluatedFeatureOnSubset(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> subset,
                                                    boolean[] acceptableFloat,
                                                    boolean[] acceptableInt,
                                                    boolean[] acceptableNominal)
        Get the type and index of the feature with the lowest evaluation. This can yield best or worst features, depending on the type of estimator score.
        Parameters:
        subset - ArrayList of integer indexes defining the subset to analyze.
        acceptableFloat - Boolean array of acceptable float features.
        acceptableInt - Boolean array of acceptable integer features.
        acceptableNominal - Boolean array of acceptable nominal features.
        Returns:
        Integer array of two elements, the first one being the type and the second one the index of the feature in its feature group.

      • getIndexOfLowestEvaluatedFeature

        public int getIndexOfLowestEvaluatedFeature(int attType)
        Get the index of the lowest evaluated feature of the specified type. This can yield best or worst features, depending on the type of estimator score.
        Parameters:
        attType - Feature type, as in DataMineConstants.
        Returns:
        Index of the lowest evaluated feature in its feature group.

      • getIndexOfLowestEvaluatedFeatureOnSubset

        public int getIndexOfLowestEvaluatedFeatureOnSubset(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> subset,
                                           int attType)
        Get the index of the lowest evaluated feature of the specified type. This can yield best or worst features, depending on the type of estimator score.
        Parameters:
        subset - ArrayList of integer indexes defining the subset to analyze.
        attType - Feature type, as in DataMineConstants.
        Returns:
        Index of the lowest evaluated feature in its feature group.

      • getIndexOfLowestEvaluatedFeatureOnSubset

        public int getIndexOfLowestEvaluatedFeatureOnSubset(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> subset,
                                           int attType,
                                           boolean[] acceptable)
        Get the index of the lowest evaluated feature of the specified type. This can yield best or worst features, depending on the type of estimator score.
        Parameters:
        subset - ArrayList of integer indexes defining the subset to analyze.
        attType - Feature type, as in DataMineConstants.
        acceptable - Boolean array indicating which features to consider.
        Returns:
        Index of the lowest evaluated feature in its feature group.

        Parameters:
        attType - Feature type, as in DataMineConstants.
        Returns:
        Index of the highest evaluated feature in its feature group.

      • evaluateAll

        public float[] evaluateAll(int attType)
        Evaluate all features of the specified feature type.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • evaluateAll

        public float[] evaluateAll(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> subset,
                  int attType)
        Evaluate all features of the specified feature type.
        Parameters:
        subset - ArrayList of integer indexes defining the subset to analyze.
        attType - Feature type, as in DataMineConstants.
        Returns:
        Float array of feature evaluations.

      • evaluateAll

        public float[] evaluateAll(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> subset,
                  int attType,
                  boolean[] acceptable)
        Evaluate all designated features of the specified feature type.
        Parameters:
        subset - ArrayList of integer indexes defining the subset to analyze.
        attType - Feature type, as in DataMineConstants.
        acceptable - Boolean array indicating which features to consider.
        Returns:
        array of feature evaluations. The default evaluation for the non-selected features is zero.
